definitions: A thickened and hardened part of the skin or soft tissue, especially in an area that has been subjected to friction.
A mass of new bony tissue that forms at the site of a fracture and is later absorbed as the fracture heals.
An undifferentiated mass of cells that develops in vitro from plant tissue and can give rise to a new plant.
examples: The guitarist had developed calluses on his fingertips.
The doctor examined the callus that had formed around the broken bone.
Scientists grew a new plant from the callus in the petri dish.
